result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary L Sager was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE will have 30 days to set up a payment plan with the COCC after release from Prison July 12, 2022.

Upon failure to pay, the Court may;

 Enter a civil judgment
 Intercept your income taxes
 Suspend your driving privilege on TR/CT cases
 Send debt to Department of Revenue.

records.addlTxt:
12:59 PM Defendant Zachary L Sager appeared by video from Jackson Correctional Inst.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for Zachary L Sager.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement has been reached in this matter. Atty Osberg recites agreement into the court record. 

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts DE's plea of G, finds DE guilty. 

DE will enter a plea to Ct's 3,4,5.  Ct's 1,2 will be DRI.  DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge. Sentencing argument entered by parties.  DE to set up payment plan with the COCC office within 30 days of release from prison. Adj 1:14PM.

8:01 AM Defendant Zachary L Sager  #00683223 appeared by video from Jackson CI.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for Zachary L Sager  #00683223.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set for PH.    Court notes that a Motion for Prompt Disposition was filed but it is not signed by the DE.     Attorney Osberg recognized that the Motion for Prompt Disposition was unsigned.   Attorney Osberg informed Court DE is not waiving his PH.   Attorney Osberg filed a Motion to Dismiss.   Court addressed Motion to Dismiss.  Attorney Osberg argument.  Attorney Nelson argument.   Attorney Osberg reply.    Court makes findings.  Court denied Motion to Dismiss.  Court informed DE he has the right to appear in person in Court.    DE understands and waived personal appearance.   Court proceeds with PH.  State called RCSD Ben Reisner.  Oath admin.  Record reflected witness identified DE.  State offered Barron County certified bonds in Barron County 19CF285 and 20CF44.  No obj.  Court received.    Attorney Osberg cross.  No re-direct.   No further witnesses.   Argument.  Court finds PC that a felony was committed and bound DE over for trial.  Court notes we have 120 days to hold trial based upon the motion for prompt disposition.   The prompt disposition request does not need to be signed.   ARGN set for 6/7/22 at 1:00 PM. along with status on the prompt disposition request.   Adj. 8:30 AM.
